title: Which is the correct word in the blank space, 'He (_________) have been sleeping at the time, ' May ' or 'Might'? - Quora

response.answer_text: He might have been sleeping at the time. The difference between may or might according to American English is: May only used when sentence is related to taking permission. You can use might in every possible sentences except “above situation”. I have noticed in British local English that they use might often than may in every possible sentences. So, you have to choose that you are either learning British English or American English. Then, shape you English lingo accordingly.
